job_title: Student Advising in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Nice campus grounds and buildings with history and located in a great neighborhood
cons:
Leaders - (president, exec team and managers) - lack understanding and show little interest regarding the challenges facing faculty/staff trying to provide high level service to the current student body.
As a direct result of poor leadership, there has been continued chaos at all levels of the university as faculty/staff with significant experience and knowledge continue to leave positions. As a result, goals and initiatives change multiple times making it difficult for any headway or success to be made and this affects current students and those who are trying to serve students.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great opportunities to learn in different areas of IT if interested. Other IT staffs are usually very easy to get along with. The University is very beautiful to walk around while on your break.
cons: On occasion, you are ever so honored to being overworked and under appreciated for the work you do. I think this goes for just about every department, but this is only my opinion from what I saw while working there. Student workers also have it very hard, if not harder since they have to learn everything, including what staffs are ONLY supposed to do for faculties, staffs, and students and attend class. Communication doesn't seem to exist in the IT department. You will think that you have access to certain things, and try to login and you call to ask around and find out they switched admin access a long time ago without informing you. If you want something for the IT department, you're most likely NOT going to get it. Most likely because the budget got cut and you have to work with what you have. This leads to over dramatic faculties, staffs, and students.

job_title: Professor in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Quality faculty who care about students; hardworking staff, beautiful campus.
cons:
Poor allocation of resources; very little faculty development; least effective people in leadership positions; failure to make tough decisions; in financial trouble; too heavy on vocational baccalaureate training such as nursing; mediocre education for many unless in best programs; grads ill prepared for graduate school. 
Safety concerns inadequately managed and non-transparent communication around problems.

review_title: great place to develop professionally among coworkers who care about public service

- salaries are low due to organizational culture that originates with nuns who value a martyrdom complex -- work very hard for very little material reward;
- as a result of the first con, the organization frequently loses talented people to neighboring institutions;

job_title: in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Working at the University of Saint Catherine was a great experience.  The people are friendly, supportive, and encouraging.  Access to educational services is optimal.
cons: As the University has recently undergone a great deal of growth, both with the recent name change from "college" to "university" and the campus expansion, I would only hope that the core values of the institution would stay intact.

review_title: Wonderful campus, needs more balance though
job_title: Coordinator in Saint Paul, MN
pros: St. Kate's is a wonderful institution and campus.  Being a part of a strong mission and values gives you a lot of great experiences.  The people who work there are wonderful and the students are amazing.
cons: The work life balance makes it difficult to retain high quality staff, creating turn over and leaving overworked employees with each transition.  Burn out is high and it makes collaborating as a whole campus difficult.

job_title: Systems/Network Administrator in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great environment, good benefits, having a job that helps/impacts students preparing to take their place in the world.
cons: Really low pay (at-least in IT). Understaffed. Team leads in IT are not very nice people / hinder advancement of anyone under them. Management will not do anything about it because they are afraid to rock the boat. There also seems to be a possibility of moving to outsourcing many facets of the department.

job_title: in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Wonderful team of people who care about furthering higher education, teaching students, and supporting that mission.  Very relaxed environment with hardworking, talented individuals.
cons: Unfortunately, the compensation is low.  St. Catherine has a very nonprofit, service culture which doesn't provide very good compensation.  It's a great place to get experience but not a great place to stay and grow due to the low pay.

review_title: Affirming and Empowering Atmosphere where you can succeed
job_title: Library Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Tight knit community. Supportive, Encouraging. Supervisors find ways to stretch and grow you in the job. Work life balance is well integrated
cons: Hard to get in or get promoted if you are not Catholic. If you're on time, you're late..procrastination not tolerated.

job_title: Student Affairs in Saint Paul, MN
pros: St. Kate's is a great community with amazing faculty and staff. The leadership and mission are strong, and I appreciate that the mission thrives throughout the campus. There is flexibility to help with work-life balance.
cons: The University is growing and adding programs, but resources are tight. Therefore, people are taking on more responsibility, which is impacting work-life balance. The University does not have a telecommute policy.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great mission with people committed to serving and teaching students from diverse backgrounds. Beautiful campus and wonderful students.  Diverse academic programs in many professional career and liberal arts areas.
cons: Due to the diversity of programs and limited budgets, staffing is tight and most staff often put in long hours to finish work.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The employees, faculty and administration of St. Kate's are wonderful. The environment of the university as a whole is supportive and welcoming, resulting in a comfortable work environment with great coworkers.
cons: There are usually few open positions within the university making it difficult to find other jobs or transition to work that would allow for further advancement or change.

review_title: Student Career Assistant in the Career Development Office
job_title: Career Assistant
pros: It's a nice and very supportive place to work for.  Great leadership. Top managements are very open minded and they listen to their employees and student employees.  Benefits are very good if you work full-time.  Full-time employees get free college tuition and their children get 75% off.
cons: Pay is not as good

job_title: Science Tutor in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Pays well for a college job, and if you're interested in grad school/academia, this is great student exposure. Also, when it's slow you can work on homework.
cons: Not many hours, some students only want answers and not to learn.

job_title: Circulation Desk Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Library staff were great, the work was enjoyable, work schedule was flexible around classes, and we were able to study or do homework during down time.
cons: Parking was awful at the Minneapolis campus, and the pay rate was not ideal.

job_title: Student Worker in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Decent pay, excellent hours, supportive supervisors, learning atmosphere, flexible scheduling with advanced notice, team oriented philosophy.
cons: Working where you go to school can be challenging to compartmentalize, you see your professors all the time.
